newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 7.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Oct 7.

text.p: * Quarterdeck Corp announced a restructuring and said it will take a significant fourth quarter charge. It also said results for the quarter and year will fall well below expectations. The stock closed at 6-5/16 on Friday.

* Ball Corp said it will exit the aerosol can manufacturing business and sell a Cincinnati plant and other assets to BWAY Corp for $36 million. Ball finished at 23-3/4 on Friday, while BWAY ended at 18-1/4.

* Thomas & Betts Corp said it will acquire Augat Inc in a deal valued at about $550 million. It said 0.68 share of Thomas & Betts will be swapped for each Augat share. Thomas & Betts closed at 39-3/4, and Augat closed at 20-7/8.
* RightChoice Managed Care Inc said it expects a third quarter net loss of $0.42 to $0.46 per share. It cited higher medical costs and pressure on premiums revenues. Shares closed at 12-1/2.

* Texaco Inc, Shell Oil Co and Star Enterprise, a venture between Texaco and Saudi Aramco, are negotiating the merger of their U.S. refining and marketing businesses, the Wall Street Journal reported. Shell declined comment on the report. Texaco closed at 95-5/8.
* Alpharma Inc said late Friday it expects to break even or post a small loss in the third quarter. Fourth quarter earnings will likely be lower than last year, it said. Shares closed at 14-7/8.
* Helisys Inc said late Friday its 1996 loss will exceed expectations. Shares closed at 2-1/4.
